headline: AI Stock Investors May Want to Heed China’s Latest Possible ‘DeepSeek’ Threat
summary: U.S. tech stocks, and the artificial-intelligence sector specifically, may be facing another competitive threat from China that could undermine faith in the market’s biggest growth driver heading into the first anniversary of the DeepSeek chatbot launch.  Reports from the South China Morning Post last week said scientists from Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Tsinghua University have developed a photon-based computing chip that can outperform traditional silicon-based wafers, such as those produced by  Nvidia  in both AI training and inferencing.  Dubbed LightGen, the new chip is faster and more efficient than  Nvidia’s  Blackwell GPUs, the report said, although its use case is tailored more toward video production and image synthesis than broader AI workloads.

content.title: AI Stock Investors May Want to Heed China’s Latest Possible ‘DeepSeek’ Threat
content.summary: U.S. tech stocks, and the artificial-intelligence sector specifically, may be facing another competitive threat from China that could undermine faith in the market’s biggest growth driver heading into the first anniversary of the DeepSeek chatbot launch.  Reports from the South China Morning Post last week said scientists from Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Tsinghua University have developed a photon-based computing chip that can outperform traditional silicon-based wafers, such as those produced by  Nvidia  in both AI training and inferencing.  Dubbed LightGen, the new chip is faster and more efficient than  Nvidia’s  Blackwell GPUs, the report said, although its use case is tailored more toward video production and image synthesis than broader AI workloads.

headline: Meta to Acquire Manus in $2 Billion Bet on AI Agents
summary: The deal values Manus at more than $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.  It marks a rare US acquisition of an Asian tech company and the latest multibillion-dollar AI bet from Meta Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg.  Meta intends to continue operating and selling the Manus service while also integrating it into its products, it said in a statement.

content.title: Meta to Acquire Manus in $2 Billion Bet on AI Agents
content.summary: The deal values Manus at more than $2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.  It marks a rare US acquisition of an Asian tech company and the latest multibillion-dollar AI bet from Meta Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg.  Meta intends to continue operating and selling the Manus service while also integrating it into its products, it said in a statement.

headline: This Week In Cloud AI - ChronoScale Emerges From Applied Digital and EKSO Collaboration
summary: Recent developments in the Cloud AI sector highlight Applied Digital's strategic move to spin out its cloud computing business, Applied Digital Cloud, and combine it with EKSO Bionics Holdings to create ChronoScale Corporation. This proposed business combination is aimed at establishing an accelerated compute platform built specifically to cater to AI workloads, reflecting the increasing demand for GPU-accelerated cloud infrastructure. By focusing on delivering high-performance compute...

headline: AI Trade’s Next Leg Is All About Tech’s ‘Pick-and-Shovel’ Stocks
summary: Data storage companies dominated the S&P 500 Index in 2025, with Sandisk Corp. shares soaring almost 580% to make them the benchmark’s best performer, with Western Digital Corp. in second and Seagate Technology Holdings Plc in fourth.  Meanwhile, AI-linked power providers and cable and fiber producers such as Amphenol Corp., Corning Inc., NRG Energy Inc. and GE Vernova Inc. were among the Top 25.

headline: AI Stocks Could Face More Trouble From China in 2026
summary: U.S. tech stocks, and the artificial-intelligence sector specifically, may be facing another competitive threat from China that could undermine faith in the market’s biggest growth driver heading into the first anniversary of the DeepSeek chatbot launch.  Reports from the South China Morning Post last week said scientists from Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Tsinghua University have developed a photon-based computing chip that can outperform traditional silicon-based wafers, such as those produced by  Nvidia  in both AI training and inferencing.  Dubbed LightGen, the new chip is faster and more efficient than Nvidia’s Blackwell GPUs, the report said, although its use case is tailored more toward video production and image synthesis than broader AI workloads.

content.title: AI Stocks Could Face More Trouble From China in 2026
content.summary: U.S. tech stocks, and the artificial-intelligence sector specifically, may be facing another competitive threat from China that could undermine faith in the market’s biggest growth driver heading into the first anniversary of the DeepSeek chatbot launch.  Reports from the South China Morning Post last week said scientists from Shanghai Jiao Tong University and Tsinghua University have developed a photon-based computing chip that can outperform traditional silicon-based wafers, such as those produced by  Nvidia  in both AI training and inferencing.  Dubbed LightGen, the new chip is faster and more efficient than Nvidia’s Blackwell GPUs, the report said, although its use case is tailored more toward video production and image synthesis than broader AI workloads.

thumbnail.caption: In this photo illustration, the social media application logo, TikTok is displayed on the screen of an iPhone on an American flag background on August 3, 2020 in Arlington, Virginia. - The US Senate voted on August 6, 2020, to bar TikTok from being downloaded onto US government employees' telephones, intensifying US scrutiny of the popular Chinese-owned video app. The bill passed by the Republican controlled Senate now goes to the House of Representatives, led by Democrats. (Photo by Olivier DOULIERY / AFP) (Photo by OLIVIER DOULIERY/AFP via Getty Images)

headline: China’s New AI Chip Is a Threat to Nvidia. Remember Deep Seek.
summary: China is hanging a new AI threat over Nvidia and America’s other chip giants that could undermine faith in Wall Street’s biggest growth driver, much like it did only a year ago with the DeepSeek chatbot launch.  Scientists at universities in Shanghai and Beijing have developed a photon-based computing chip for artificial-intelligence training and inferencing that can outperform traditional silicon-based wafers, such as those produced by  Nvidia  the South China Morning Post reported.  Dubbed LightGen, the new chip is faster and more efficient than Nvidia’s Blackwell GPUs, the report said, although its use case is tailored more for video production and image synthesis than broader AI workloads.

content.title: China’s New AI Chip Is a Threat to Nvidia. Remember Deep Seek.
content.summary: China is hanging a new AI threat over Nvidia and America’s other chip giants that could undermine faith in Wall Street’s biggest growth driver, much like it did only a year ago with the DeepSeek chatbot launch.  Scientists at universities in Shanghai and Beijing have developed a photon-based computing chip for artificial-intelligence training and inferencing that can outperform traditional silicon-based wafers, such as those produced by  Nvidia  the South China Morning Post reported.  Dubbed LightGen, the new chip is faster and more efficient than Nvidia’s Blackwell GPUs, the report said, although its use case is tailored more for video production and image synthesis than broader AI workloads.

headline: What the Buffett Indicator says about the bull market, AI trade
summary: After 60 years at the top of one of the world's biggest investment firms, Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) CEO Warren Buffett will be handing off the leadership reins to Greg Abel at the end of 2025. The Oracle of Omaha was also noted to have invented the Buffett Indicator, which assesses the valuation of the stock market by dividing the total value of US stocks with the total US GDP (gross domestic product). Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on how much longer the Buffett Indicator may be calling for a continued bull market, while Miramar Capital Co-Founder and senior portfolio manager Max Wasserman comments on his outlook on the AI trade when factoring in Warren Buffett's market formula. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

content.title: What the Buffett Indicator says about the bull market, AI trade
content.description:
After 60 years at the top of one of the world's biggest investment firms, Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-A, BRK-B) CEO Warren Buffett will be handing off the leadership reins to Greg Abel at the end of 2025. The Oracle of Omaha was also noted to have invented the Buffett Indicator, which assesses the valuation of the stock market by dividing the total value of US stocks with the total US GDP (gross domestic product).

Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on how much longer the Buffett Indicator may be calling for a continued bull market, while Miramar Capital Co-Founder and senior portfolio manager Max Wasserman comments on his outlook on the AI trade when factoring in Warren Buffett's market formula.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

The Oracle of Omaha was also noted to have invented the Buffett Indicator, which assesses the valuation of the stock market by dividing the total value of US stocks with the total US GDP (gross domestic product). Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma weighs in on how much longer the Buffett Indicator may be calling for a continued bull market, while Miramar Capital Co-Founder and senior portfolio manager Max Wasserman comments on his outlook on the AI trade when factoring in Warren Buffett's market formula. headline: Super Micro Stock Had a Wild 2025. What to Expect in 2026.
summary: Coming into Tuesday, shares of the server maker, once a darling of the artificial-intelligence trade, had fallen 1.3% this year.  Super Micro’s performance also pales in comparison to how other tech companies have done this year.  Shares surged more than 45% in February, when Super Micro narrowly avoided delisting from the  Nasdaq Stock Market  capping months of speculation that a failure to file its financial results on time might cost the company its spot in the exchange.

content.title: Super Micro Stock Had a Wild 2025. What to Expect in 2026.
content.summary: Coming into Tuesday, shares of the server maker, once a darling of the artificial-intelligence trade, had fallen 1.3% this year.  Super Micro’s performance also pales in comparison to how other tech companies have done this year.  Shares surged more than 45% in February, when Super Micro narrowly avoided delisting from the  Nasdaq Stock Market  capping months of speculation that a failure to file its financial results on time might cost the company its spot in the exchange.
